meanings.definition: Of the darkest color owing to the absence of or complete absorption of light.
meanings.sent1: The room was so dark that it appeared blacks to me.
meanings.sent2: The night sky was filled with twinkling stars against a blacks background.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it could hide in the blacks corner, but its tail gave it away.
meanings.sent4: His mood turned as blacks as a storm cloud when he heard the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The forest was shrouded in blacks shadows, creating an eerie atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A member of a dark-skinned people, especially one of African or Australian Aboriginal ancestry.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a painting of ancient blacks from a distant land.
meanings.sent2: She met a group of friendly blacks at the community center.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended to be a mysterious blacks from a faraway land.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of faces, she spotted a familiar blacks waving at her.
meanings.sent5: The history book detailed the struggles faced by the early blacks settlers.

meanings.definition: A dark substance or colorant used to darken or color something.
meanings.sent1: The artist mixed different shades to create a unique blacks for the painting.
meanings.sent2: She spilled some blacks on her shirt while working on the art project.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added too much blacks to the soup, turning it inedible.
meanings.sent4: The ink in the pen was a deep blacks, perfect for writing important documents.
meanings.sent5: The hairdresser recommended a touch of blacks to enhance the natural color of her hair.
